Titre: Internship - Procurement Equipment & Systems - Supplier Rati...
Descriptif_du_poste:
Toulouse (31)
Temps plein, Stage
AIRBUS SAS
Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2018 it generated revenues of € 64 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Airbus offers the most comprehensive range of passenger airliners. Airbus is also a European leader providing tanker, combat, transport and mission aircraft, as well as one of the world's leading space companies. In helicopters, Airbus provides the most efficient civil and military rotorcraft solutions worldwide.

Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place. Taking pride in our work, we draw on each other's expertise and experience to achieve excellence. Our diversity and teamwork culture propel us to accomplish the extraordinary - on the ground, in the sky and in space.
Job Description
What if YOU starts your journey with US!
As part of a school curriculum in initial training, you are looking for a mandatory internship or integrated into a gap year that will allow you to validate your studies. The internship duration is 4 to 6 months maximum.
We are looking for Internship - Procurement Equipment & Systems - Supplier Rating (f/m) who will be joining us at Airbus site in Toulouse.
This internship is to be filled from January 2020 (the dates are subject to a certain flexibility)
You will be joining a transversal department, coordinating three fields of activities for Procurement Equipment, System and Services: Strategy Development, Business Improvement and Operational Excellence.
The team covers topics like Business Intelligence, Sourcing Strategy, Cost Optimization projects, Supplier Relationship Management, Project and Change Management, Digitalization, Innovation Management, or Processes and Tools.
Within the team (of 10), you will join a highly motivated team in a continuously improving environment.
Your main mission, tasks and activities will include:
You will be working under the supervision of your manager who will help you identify your professional objectives and support you in the development of your skills.
You will be managing the 2020 Supplier Evaluation & Development (SED) campaign for Equipment & Systems suppliers, under the leadership of the Supplier Relationship Manager in charge of this activity. This campaign consists in the evaluation of the Suppliers on Commercial, Quality, Delivery, Engineering and Customer Services performance.
The project will include:
Propose recommendation on the tool to support the activity (either dedicated Microsoft Access application called “mySED”, either Excel / G-Suite based applications),
Propose roadmap for the rating campaign (Kick-Of Meeting, Target for Data Recovery, Multi-Functional Team meeting, Calibration, Flyers release) in coherence with the overall milestones (Paris or Farnborough Airshow as applicable),
Define Work-package structure for supplier evaluation (around 15 Suppliers / 39 business units),
Identify key stakeholders to run the process across the organisation (including inside and outside Procurement organisation),
Actively support contributors to recover the data and ensure regular follow-up with Multi-Functional Team (MFT) for campaign progress,
Propose Work-package weighting (according to Turnover or Strategic position),
Be the focal point to support Multi-Functional Teams (MFT) and represent PEY in regular meeting / follow-up on tools,
Ensure alignment for performance recovery, aligning tool structure vs Operational data sources, with Quality, Delivery and Customer Services,
Monitor consistency of the inputs (Performance assessed by MFT against supportive message/explanation),
Ensure the support of management validation reviews,
Ensure edition of Flyers in due time and quality,
Propose and gather return of experience of the campaign, proposing recommendation for improvements.
In complement to the rating project, the intern will have the opportunity to work on different projects in order to improve one’s understanding of the organisation and of the overall business environment.
You are preparing a diploma level Bac+ 4 to Bac +5
You are an enrolled student within Business Information Technology, Supply Chain Management/Logistics, Business Administration or a similar field of study. Engineering students with an interest in Procurement matters are also very welcome.
You are proactive and positive, team player,
You have developed good communication skills,
You are able to work independently and in autonomy,
Proficient with MS-Office / G-Suite / IT skills,
Negotiation level of English
Depending on the specifics of the offer, you may have to travel to another locations.
If your profile catches our attention, you will be invited to perform a video interview during which you will have a few minutes to tell us about your background, motivations and your professional project. Afterwards, your application could be proposed to the managers for further review.
If the prospect of joining our innovative Group motivates you do not hesitate and apply online on our website www.airbus.com/careers!

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Toulouse (31)
Description de l'offre

Fondée en 2005, TRIMANE est une société de services spécialisée dans la Business Intelligence & le Big Data.

Nous nous sommes développés à travers l'idée qu'une société de services a en réalité deux clients :
Le client final, qui bénéficie de l'expertise des consultants,
Le consultant, qui au fur et à mesure des missions acquiert de nouvelles compétences.
Pour réaliser cette idée, nous nous appuyons sur les valeurs suivantes :

Honnêteté et transparence :
Nous nous attachons à notre devoir de conseil auprès de nos clients en leur proposant les solutions les plus adaptées à leur besoin,
Nous nous attachons à proposer à nos consultants des missions leur permettant de poursuivre l'évolution de carrière qu'ils souhaitent.
Expertise : En plus des compétences sur différents outils du marché, nous apportons également à nos clients une expertise méthodologique forte dans le domaine de la BI.
Convivialité et esprit d'équipe : Nous entretenons un solide esprit d'équipe et d'entraide entre nos collaborateurs. Ceci permet aux consultants d'accroître leurs compétences, et aux clients de bénéficier de meilleures prestations.

D'avantage qu'une simple société de services, TRIMANE c'est, avant tout, la rencontre de personnes passionnées par leur métier qui ont envie d'avancer ensemble.

Nous recherchons aujourd'hui des consultants qui souhaitent nous faire partager leur expertise et s'investir dans une structure à taille humaine (95 personnes).

Dans le cadre de développement de projet décisionnel, vous accompagnerez nos clients autour de la mise en place de solutions BI, vos missions principales consistent en :

Analyse des besoins des utilisateurs et métiers
Rédaction des spécifications techniques et fonctionnelles
Conception du DWH et des Datamarts
Développement des flux d'alimentation et du reporting
Bâtir les stratégies de recette, mener les tests d'intégration technique et fonctionnelle ainsi que leur validation par les référents métiers
En fonction de votre expérience, vous serez également amené à intervenir sur les tâches suivantes :

Participer aux phases de cadrage
Gestion de projet
Conseil et audit
Ces projets vous amèneront à manipuler des outils tels que Talend, SAP Business Object, Oracle, Tableau Software, QlikSense, Cognos, SAS, Informatica, Datastage, Microsoft BI, etc.

Vous êtes diplômé d'un Master 2 (bac+5) ou d'une école d'ingénieur, idéalement avec une spécialisation décisionnelle, statistiques, intelligence artificielle, ou encore Big Data, etc.

Vous bénéficiez (de préférence) d'une première expérience en envronnement décisonnel et vous souhaitez monter en compétences sur des sujets variés autour du traitement et analyse des données (BI, Big Data, Data Sceince, Machine learning et bien d'autres !).

De plus, vous êtes autonome, passionné et aimez le travail en équipe.

Airbus Operations SAS
Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2018 it generated revenues of € 64 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Airbus offers the most comprehensive range of passenger airliners. Airbus is also a European leader providing tanker, combat, transport and mission aircraft, as well as one of the world's leading space companies. Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place. Taking pride in our work, we draw on each other's expertise and experience to achieve excellence. Job Description
Description of the job :
Are you passionate about mechanical engineering and do you want to develop fatigue and damage tolerance competences?
Do you want to get hands on experience of the newest technologies?
Do you want to be part of the engineering activities for the next generation of aircraft?
Are you also convinced that we can challenge the way we work and propose new ideas?
Then this could be the ideal role for you.

Task & accountabilities :
What you will do:
You will join the Nose & Front Fuselage (NFF) and CWB engineering organization and be part of an integrated team having the global view on aircraft structure design and justifications.
Within our team, you will have the opportunity to work on, amongst other things: Certification activities, Methods & Tools, improvements, Weight saving, Design to Cost and Manufacturing support.

More particularly:
You will be working closely with the Plants, Programmes, and Customer Services to develop our Engineering solutions. You will join the Stress community, working directly for the Head of Stress.
Your activities will range from daily support to Major Modifications to Development activities, without forgetting our Agile projects and support to production.
You will work on the analysis of all structures and mechanisms, whilst supporting system installation requests.
You will work on the calculation, justification, and certification of these solutions, whilst contributing to the Structure Evolution
Plan and Quality Improvement as part of your development.

In parallel, the emergence of new technologies in data science, Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Simulation is transforming aircraft design and use. Your willingness to bring and concretize digital transformation (data modelling and /or simulation for design and manufacturing) applications to our company would make you a perfect match.
This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth.

This role will involve some travel for business and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :
Your boarding pass:
You have studied Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering.
You have a strong experience in Fatigue & Damage Tolerance.
You are autonomous, curious and proactive.
You are open minded and synthetic with capability to step back from activities and propose new ideas.
You have the capability to face complex situations and take data driven-decisions by using data analytics or model-based system engineering platforms.
Working in Airbus implies to work in an international environment, as such you shall be able to communicate easily in English.
You are to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth.

This position has been graded II.

Position Description:
Fondé en 1976, Groupe CGI inc. est la cinquième plus importante entreprise indépendante de services en technologies de l'information et en gestion des processus d'affaires au monde.

Grâce à ses quelque 77 000 professionnels, CGI offre un portefeuille complet de services, y compris des services-conseils stratégiques en informatique et en management, des services d'intégration de systèmes, de développement et de maintenance d'applications informatiques, de gestion d'infrastructures technologiques ainsi qu'une vaste gamme de solutions exclusives à des milliers de clients à l'échelle mondiale à partir de ses bureaux et centres mondiaux de prestation de services dans les Amériques, en Europe et en Asie-Pacifique. Site Web : www.cgi.com.

CGI en France est le 4ème acteur indépendant en conseil et services en technologies de l'information réunissant 11 000 collaborateurs présents dans 22 villes.

Spécialisé autour des solutions CRM, BI et Digital Entreprise incontournables du marché, notre entité apporte son savoir-faire et ses retours d'expérience aux clients (Marketing Digital, Parcours de fidélisation, DMP, ETL, Data Quality, Data Mining, Big Data, progiciels de gestion intégrés, Digital Customer Experience, portails d'entreprise, CMS, mobilité, User eXperience, studio graphique et autres), en partenariat avec les principaux éditeurs du marché.


Vous interviendrez sur des missions de Master Data Management, de Data Quality Management, de conseil organisationnel, stratégique ou opérationnel. Vous contribuerez au développement de notre offre de service, participerez à l'avant-vente.

Vous intégrerez une équipe solidaire et dynamique qui vous accompagnera tout au long de vos missions.

En tant Consultant(e) Gouvernance de la Donnée, vous serez intégré dans un pôle de consultants spécialistes de la BI, du Big Data et de la Data Science intervenants sur des projets analytiques stimulants. Vos missions sont :

Concevoir et déployer des solutions de Master Data Management, de DQM ou ESB
Animer des ateliers de conception fonctionnelle et technique
Participer à des missions de conseil et d'audit
Participer à la veille technologique autour des problématiques de gouvernance des données
Participer à l'animation de l'offre (évènements, présentations, plaquettes, …)
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
Passionné de nouvelles technologies, la Business Intelligence, les nouveaux enjeux de la donnée, vous aimez le travail en équipe, apprendre, partager, vous êtes également dotés d'un esprit audacieux et ambitieux. Vous faites preuve d'initiative et travaillez sur le long terme.

De formation ingénieur ou Bac+5, vous justifiez d'une expérience significative dans la Gouvernance des Données, vous êtes doté d'un excellent relationnel et à l'aise à l'écrit.

Vous disposez d'une vision large des technologies et vous maîtrisez au moins l'un des logiciels du marché (Informatica, Talend, IBM InfoSphere, Tibco, Oracle …).

La connaissance d'un des outils ESB suivants est un plus : Talend ESB, Tibco BusinessWorks, Mule ESB, Webmethods.

Votre dynamisme, votre ambition et votre goût du challenge sont vos atouts pour réussir dans ce poste.

Comme tous les postes de l'entreprise, ce poste est ouvert aux personnes en situation de handicap

What you can expect from us:
Donnez un élan à votre carrière.

Le secteur des technologies de l'information (TI) connaît une période extraordinaire. La transformation numérique des organisations continue de s'accélérer, et CGI est au premier plan de ce changement. Nous accompagnons nos clients dans leur démarche numérique et offrons à nos professionnels des opportunités de carrière stimulantes.

La réussite de CGI repose sur le talent et l'engagement de nos professionnels. Ensemble, nous relevons les défis et partageons les bénéfices issus de la croissance de notre entreprise. Cette approche renforce notre culture d'actionnaire-propriétaire ainsi, tous nos professionnels bénéficient de la valeur que nous créons collectivement.

Joignez-vous à nous pour prendre part à la croissance de l'une des plus importantes entreprises indépendantes de services en technologies de l'information (TI) et en gestion des processus d'affaires au monde.

Pour en savoir davantage à propos de CGI : www.cgi.com.

Titre: User Interface and Experience Specialist for the Web Factory...
Descriptif_du_poste:
Toulouse (31)
Airbus DS Geo SA
Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2018 it generated revenues of € 64 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Airbus offers the most comprehensive range of passenger airliners. Airbus is also a European leader providing tanker, combat, transport and mission aircraft, as well as one of the world's leading space companies. In helicopters, Airbus provides the most efficient civil and military rotorcraft solutions worldwide.

Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place. Taking pride in our work, we draw on each other's expertise and experience to achieve excellence. Our diversity and teamwork culture propel us to accomplish the extraordinary - on the ground, in the sky and in space.
Job Description
Contact :
Please apply on line for this vacancy on line at our careers site (www.jobs.airbus.com) with your CV and cover letter attached.
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Description of the job :
The Earth Observation (EO) service based on imagery data collected from space or from stratosphere is a fast growing business. To strengthen its current position of world number 2 on the EO space data market, Airbus Defence and Space has engaged the development of its future service capacities both in terms of data collection, including in particular the manufacturing of new constellation of satellites, and in terms of digital information system based on
Cloud technologies.

The INTELLIGENCE business cluster of Airbus DS CIS (CIS-INT) is running a large program :
renewing its geo-information services facilities & solutions,
improving its operational efficiency,
preparing future geo-information services at 2020 horizon,
preparing for the accommodation of Post-Pléiades system.

In parallel, several projects will be run to develop and deliver to customers the geo-imagery infrastructure solutions derived from the project design.

A position of User Interface (UI) and Experience (UX) Specialist has just opened within the Earth Observation application frontend development entity in Toulouse. This organization, the Web Factory (WF), within « Web Portals & Mobile » service, strives to implement Agile and DevOps concepts in order to meet the objectives of this enterprise transformation program.

The Web Factory is composed of a Core Team in charge of dev support roles, notably: frontend architecture (including reusable components), continuous integration chain, automated tests strategy definition and support, API strategy and design.

This position will require a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities.

Task & accountabilities :
In parallel to the development and maintenance of thematic GIS application frontend projects (Scrums), you will be in charge of the following main activities:
participate to workshops with Product Owners (and developers) to build storyboards or process / navigation flows
design graphic user interface
develop User Interface mockups and prototypes
contribute to corporate graphic standard UI
contribute to our frontend toolkit for developers (FRET)
integrate (develop) designed interface into the final technical product (HTML/SCSS integration)
support other frontend developers for HTML/CSS integration

This role will involve occasional travel for business and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :
You have the experience and the following skills:
Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role (access to portfolio examples is necessary)
Knowledge of wireframing tools (Balsamiq, Axure) prototyping tools (Sketch, Invision, Marvel)
Knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator
Strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders
HTML, CSS, CSS preprocessors: advanced coding skills
Basic knowledge of Angular is a plus
Dev tools: Gitlab, JIRA, Confluence
Agile Scrum method
Languages: written English (a good speaking level is a plus), fluent French.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.
il y a 30+ jours

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a Pre Sales Project Manager (m/f) has arisen within Airbus Defence & Space (Intelligence) in Toulouse. As the successful candidate, you will join the Ground Segment, IMINT and GEOINT Programmes (“TCIMI2” department).

Contribute in winning proposals, especially by making consistent and realistic quotation

when the bid is awarded, making a proper hand over to the project manager.

Educated to an engineering degree level or equivalent.

Description of the job :
A vacancy for HO Cyber Security Foundations and Extended Enterprise, (m/f) has arisen within Airbus (Commercial Aircraft) in Toulouse. You will join the Information Management Cyber Security Department

You will benefit working with vibrant and diverse teams of engineers, developing your skills through extensive dedicated training programs, opportunity to travel and you will be empowered to make the difference!

This position will require a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities.

Leadership
a. There are demonstrably passionate and are focused on business value and cyber risk management
b. Influence and impact - They have the ability to identify the key senior stakeholders to engage, how to engage them, and get their buy in.
c. They set standards and live by these for leadership.
d. They can set a common vision, roadmap and lead their teams to this.
e. They are structured and risk driven in their prioritization.
f. They turn strategy into execution.

Key behavioural traits:
a. Joining the dots. A natural propensity to collaboration across Airbus Group.
b. Speed matters. They have a propensity for speed and execution

Problem solving
a. They use the past to help define the future
b. They can take risk based decisions
c. They do not need 100% data to make a decision.
d. They can draw down on their experience where it makes sense/low risk to go fast

People development
a. They are passionate about their people and their development
b. They are aware of their peoples needs and how to development them
c. They embrace diversity and background of thought, and use the collective intelligence to solve problems.

Communication skills
a. Able to communicate complex topics to senior leaders to gain buy in
b. Able bridge business and technical topics to achieve desired outcomes
c. Able to facilitate and drive commercial discussions with multiple parties for an optimum outcome

Task & accountabilities :

Lead the service delivery of all Cyber Products and Services relating to Security Foundations, Extended Enterprise and Global Airbus Commercial international regions. This includes but not limited to:
o Foundational cyber security controls (hosting, end user computing etc) and risks management
o Extended enterprise cyber security controls and risks management
o Airbus Commercial international regions, cyber security controls and risks management
Work closely with Cyber Transformation Program to identify the business risks relating to Security Foundation and Extended Enterprise, develop and execute risk treatment plan by implementing technical capabilities
Drive the technical and non-technical discussion regarding Foundations, Extended Enterprise and Airbus commercial international regions to ensure the appropriate security capabilities, compliance, key reporting and continuous improvement in place.
Steering complex technical and commercial decisions with significant business impact within and beyond our organization
Bridge the cyber security gaps between Airbus IM and Airbus Commercial regions under the One Roof.
Set strategic directions that supports the seamless integration and collaboration between One Roof and Airbus Group (including IM and ZS)
Facilitate governance forums with participants of varying level from senior leadership team to technical IM lead
This role will involve some travel for business in Europe and OneRoof regions and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.
Execute the associated transformation.

Required skills :
You will have the following skills and experience:
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or relevant field
15+ years experience in security, risk, compliance and commercial functions in large enterprise organisations
10+ years leadership roles, directly managing people and teams of over 20+ people across multiple regions
Demonstrated leader / influencer / decision maker profile in high impact business decision
People management skills, proven track record of mentoring and coaching team members
Great communication, mentoring team members, collaborative culture across multiple regions

Lead sur les parties d’idéation, Conception et implémentation de la solution
Lors de l'idéation, l’architecte de la solution établit le contexte métier complet de la solution et définit la vision et les exigences de la solution.
Au cours de la conception, l’architecte de la solution élabore des options potentielles, notamment des RFI, des RFP ou le développement de prototypes. Il sélectionne l'option la plus optimale et développe la feuille de route pour la solution sélectionnée.
Au cours de la mise en œuvre, l'architecture de la solution communique l'architecture aux parties prenantes et guide l'équipe de mise en œuvre
Mise en œuvre de l’expertise (audit, installation, architecture, bonnes pratiques…)
Participation aux avant-ventes (rédaction des propositions commerciales, chiffrage, POC)
Participer au développement de l’activité BI
Votre profil
De formation informatique ou généraliste (école d’ingénieur ou équivalent), vous justifiez d’une expérience solide sur une poste similaire.
Vous maîtrisez au moins un outil de data visualisation (Microsoft BI, Qlikview/Qlik Sense, Tableau, DigDash, ODI, Datastage, Informatica, BO, Cognos, Talend, Oracle, Tagetik, etc…) et/ou Connaissance dans la gestion de base de données (administration, manipulation, SQL).
Vous êtes capable d'entrer rapidement dans les sujets, et avez une bonne capacité d'analyse. Vous savez vous adapter à des contextes projets complexes.
Anglais courant exigé.

Leadership

Problem solving

People development

Communication skills
a. Able to communicate complex topics to senior leaders to gain buy in
b. Able bridge business and technical topics to achieve desired outcomes
c. Able to facilitate and drive commercial discussions with multiple parties for an optimum outcome

Task & accountabilities :

Lead the transformation program of all Cyber Security domain in Global Airbus Commercial international regions This includes but not limited to:
o Define and oversee the global change Plan, monitor and lead the Global transformation for the whole domain
o Implement the plan into the domain
o identify the business risks relating, develop and execute risk treatment plan by implementing technical capabilities
Work closely with Cyber Security Foundation and Extended Enterprise, Digital Security & Cyber Consulting, Most Valuable Information Protection, Industrial Cyber Security, Cyber Security Defence Center SoC, to identify the change implementation, develop and execute change treatment plan by implementing technical capabilities
Steering complex technical and commercial decisions with significant business impact within and beyond our organization
Bridge the cyber security gaps between Airbus IM and Airbus Commercial regions under the One Roof.
Set strategic directions that supports the seamless integration and collaboration between One Roof and Airbus Group (including IM and ZS)
Facilitate governance forums with participants of varying level from senior leadership team to technical IM lead
This role will involve some travel for business in Europe and OneRoof regions and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.
Execute the associated transformation.

Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or relevant field
15+ years experience in security, risk, compliance and commercial functions in large enterprise organisations
10+ years leadership roles, directly managing people and teams of over 20+ people across multiple regions
Demonstrated leader / influencer / decision maker profile in high impact business decision
People management skills, proven track record of mentoring and coaching team members
Great communication, mentoring team members, collaborative culture across multiple regions

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a Project Management Officer – PMO (m/f) has arisen within Airbus Defence & Space in Toulouse (Ramonville). As the successful candidate you will join the IMINT (Imagery intelligence)/GEOINT (Geospatial Intelligence) Programmes department.

The Multi Intelligence activities are in a major and sustainable growth context, and Airbus is staffing the Project Management Office for the portfolio of geospatial intelligence projects, based in Toulouse.

As Project Management Officer-PMO- you will support the project managers team for a portfolio of GEOINT/IMINT projects (France and export).You will assist them in Costs Management, Risks and Opportunities Management and Schedule Management.

You will be responsible for the set-up and follow-up of Key Project Indicators (KPI) of the project portfolio managed in GEOINT/IMINT programmes department.


Airbus Defence & Space benefit from a unique position on the Multi Intelligence/Geo Intelligence Market, covering all the Intelligence domains (GEOINT, IMINT, COMINT-Communications Intelligence, ELINT-Electronic Intelligence, OSINT-Open Source Intelligence , ..), and being at the same time Data/Image owner thanks to its own satellites constellations,

The Airbus Intelligence Projects and activities are a major corner stone of Airbus Defence & Space Strategy, pioneering developments in the field of Big Data and Analytics for the Massive Intelligence Market.

This position will require a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:

Costs management : Set-up project costs base, monitor costs and prepare Monthly Project Reports and interface with Finance and with internal and external WP when needed
Project schedule : Building and maintaining the Project Schedule
Risk Management and Opportunity Management : Participate in building the Risk Mitigation plan and Manage periodic Risk reviews and follow Risk Mitigation action plans
Work load Management: Consolidate the workload estimate and ensure the consistencies with cost estimates
Project KPI management related to costs and schedule management and contribute in Project Synthesis dashboards, Project presentations and Maturity Gates preparation
Projects actions and deliveries follow-on: follow-on of action item during periodic internal progress meeting, ensure the organization and administration of collaboration tools

Required skills :
You will have the following skills and experience:

Educated to a Business Administration degree or equivalent.
First experience in Project and Program management, Risk & Opportunity Management Execution.
Good knowledge and experience Costs Management and associated tools (MS Excel) are needed.
Good knowledge and experience in Project planning and associated tools (MS Project) are needed.
Experience or exposure to international Projects is desirable.
Good interpersonal and communication skills.
Openness and multi-cultural awareness.
Negotiation level of French.
At least an advanced level of English.

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a DIGITAL SECURITY ARCHITECT has arisen within Airbus Defence & Space in Toulouse.

The INTELLIGENCE business cluster of Airbus DS CIS (CIS-INT) is running a large program in charge of deploying the new Intelligence digital services offers. This program is composed by different components/applications under the steering of different entities and projects. These components/applications are deployed in a public cloud (GCP) with strong relationships with the Intelligence legacy.

CIS-INT is recruiting a Digital Security Architect (m/f) to support the program teams in the handling, the overall specification and the design of all the security aspects of the geo-information digital services facilities.
Beyond the scope, we expect that he contribute to the improvement of the security on a global scale, covering the full Intelligence IS landscape.

Within Security governance team, and under Head Of information security France responsibility, Digital Security Architect works in closed relationship with:
Security operations to ensure the global consistency of solutions with existing security frameworks, tools and processes
The GEO enterprise architect who is responsible for the global consistency of the GEO IS, including Security topic.
The solution architect
The GDS security architect

This position will require a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:

Responsible for the security from the requirements definition to the implementation of the solution, including evolutions and maintenance.
Participate to the architecture to define the adequate end-to-end solutions fulfilling the security requirements based on security policy, security best practices and his experience. Contribution from a security standpoint to the various components architecture trade-offs to be performed before selection of design.
Ensure the consistent integration in a global IS landscape from a security standpoint
Support to teams in the security design and implementation, driving force for suggestions and advice, with respect to security requirements. Guarantee coherence between the security requirements and the subsystems/components implementation
Responsible for security concepts and requirements (risk analyses, security objectives, classification of data, network partitioning, etc.)
Contribute to the compliance matrix of all related security requirements.
Support the teams to define adequate tests in order to verify security requirements
Verify the test plans related to security of all subsystem and propose testing Tools
Participate to the validation of security requirements and, more globally, to security acceptance
Contribute to the security certification leaded by the team in charge of company security governance
Being the focal point to negotiate possible temporary deviations
Contribute to the export control process
Ensuring the technological watch on the digital, cybersecurity field

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

This role will involve occasional travel for business and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :
You will have the following skills and experience:
At least 5 years in security architecture and architecture of systems.
Strong experience in Cloud computing and Security of Cloud environment: architecture, right and access management..., Definition of security requirements for a Cloud implementation, Use of associated standard / best practices: SecNumCloud, Cloud Security Alliance...
- Strong experience in Web application security: Experience in API security (authentication, session management...), Management of - AAA (Authentication, Authorization and Audit), Use or strong knowledge in Web Security standards/best practices: OWASP...
Knowledge of current techniques of data attacks and extractions
ANSSI Guidelines, EBIOS methodology, security architecture, knowledge in risk analysis
Architecture modeling, requirements allocation
Experience in Agile and/or Safe development method
An Experience in DevOps would be appreciated
An experience in Earth Observation systems (functions, performances, operations) would be appreciated
Strong coordination skills
Ability to negotiate and find consensus,
Good writer
Team player
French: negotiation level
English: negotiation level

renewing its geo-information services facilities & solutions,
improving its operational efficiency,
preparing future geo-information services at 2020 horizon,
preparing for the accommodation of Post-Pleiades system.

CIS-INT is recruiting a Security Architect (m/f) to support the system engineering team of the GDS program in the design of all the security aspects of the geo-information services facilities.

All sub system leaders in order to insure correct implementation and test of security requirements
The mission is applicable to :
The system that is used internally by Airbus DS to operate the fleet of satellites and deliver the services
The infrastructure solutions that may be delivered to the users of Airbus DS services.

Support the subsystem team to define adequate tests in order to verify security requirements
Verify the test plans related to security of all subsystem and propose testing Tools

Produce the technical documents that justify the implementation of the security with in the infrastructures delivered to the Airbus customers at Export

- Web application security: Experience in API security (authentication, session management...), Management of - AAA (Authentication, Authorization and Audit), Use or strong knowledge in Web Security standards/best practices: OWASP...
Cloud computing: Security of Cloud environment: architecture, right and access management..., Definition of security requirements for a Cloud implementation, Use of associated standard / best practices: SecNumCloud, Cloud Security Alliance...

+5-year experience in ground system design and integration
Knowledge of Earth Observation systems (functions, performances, operations)

Description of the job :
I4D Backend Solutions is a set of home-products of Airbus DS (CIS-INT) designed to store, catalogue and disseminate geospatial data from various sources such as Pleiades satellite images. It consists of core reusable components, along with plugins designed for specific projects. It is deployed either on legacy baremetal infrastructures or on cloud environments. It is actively maintained and fosters significant developments in an innovative context, mainly in the field of intelligence centers.

A vacancy for a I4D Backend Software Developer has arisen within Airbus Defence & Space in Toulouse.

This position will require a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities.



Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:
¤ You contribute to the development of I4D backend features, in an agile awareness
¤ You analyze defects and implements bug fixes as well as evolutions
¤ You participate actively to the definition of the technical roadmap
¤ You write the reference design documentation
¤ You work closely with system architects in order to meet the technical and functional expectations
¤ You drive specific technical studies (spikes) in order to assess the viability of critical choices
¤ You keep the pace with the various technologies, standards and protocols in use
¤ You participate in the scaled-agile organization meetings

This role will involve occasional travel for business and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :
You will have the following skills and experience:
¤ Educated to a Master's degree in information technology
¤ Strong experience of Java on backend systems, and possibly other languages such as C#
¤ Good experience in software design and architecture, particularly in geomatics contexts
¤ Basic experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD)
¤ Good knowledge in ElasticSearch, PostgreSQL and also Git, SonarQube and Docker
¤ Good experience in agile environments
¤ Synthetic, rigorous and consistent.
¤ Proactive, good communication and team spirit

Fluent in English.

Contact :

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a DDMS Industrial System senior data scientist (m/f) has arisen within Airbus in Toulouse.

You will join the Industrial System Design and Modelling Center of Competence for Airbus Commercial within multicultural environment.
Do you have a passion for manufacturing and have expertise in data science?
Have you experienced the power of data science in industrial environment?
Are you interested in leading digital transformation in a high-performance motivated team to deliver industry 4.0?
As Industrial Senior Data scientist in Airbus Commercial you will shape our Advanced Analytics journey for Industrial performance purpose.
You will have the opportunity to work on exciting technologies journey within Aeronautics industry leader.

Are you ready to take the challenge?

Then take the chance and apply now for the next step in your career!

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:

Define Data analytics, AI, ML strategy for Industrial performance analysis and prediction (Architecture, Roadmap, technical solutions, competences).
Define Data architecture, data requirements to define Multi-Modal information access for Industrial (from row data to smart data).
Develop, test and validate the advance analytics models (Model Reduction, Clusters Algorithms, Learnings Algorithms...).
Build integrated data sets, analyse data sources (ML/AI), and build compelling visualizations (typically Python, R, Spark) to create Industrial Digital Twin and Industrial Digital Shadow.
Create appropriate documentation and knowledge transfer materials to ensure effective, efficient and safe model implementation and integration into MBSE ecosystem.
Drive and deliver specific data analysis requested by Industrial system Engineer
Advise industrial community.
Creating best practices by delivering demonstrators, pilots and serial deployment for Industrial using current and future toolset.
Identifying current or future skill gaps in the frame of Industrial MBSE and derive and address adequate actions.

This role will involve frequent travel for business twice month) in Europe and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :
You will have the following skills and experience:

Educated to Master's degree in computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, data management, information systems, information science or equivalent.
The ideal candidate will have a combination of IT skills, data governance skills, analytics skills and industrial Engineering knowledge with a technical or computer science degree.
At least 3 years of experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in Industrial in support of a departmental and/or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative.
A deep understanding and proven experience with advanced analytics techniques and applications in Industrial Environment within MBSE environment.
Significant experience using inferential statistics / machine learning (e.g. statistical testing, clustering, PCA, SVM, random forests, regression, neural networks).
Proficient programming skills in at least two of the following: Python, Spark and/or Hadoop R, Java.
Experience delivering within one of the sub-domains of analytics, such as machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistical analysis (GLM, Bayesian Models, Non-Parametric Models, etc...).
Experience with Hadoop stack and Big Data tools. Experience with time series is a plus.
Experience in data visualization using open source and commercial tools.
Six Sigma Black Belt certification (or in progress).

Strong interpersonal skills, with an emphasis on the ability to effectively influence others, and a collaborative approach are a must.
A team-focused mentality with the proven ability to work effectively with diverse stakeholders.
An ability to communicate complex and technical issues to diverse audiences, orally and in writing, in an easily-understood, authoritative, and actionable manner.

Language Skills: negotiation level of English.

The position has been graded BVA- BVB

Fondée en 2005, TRIMANE est une société de services spécialisée dans la Business Intelligence & le Big Data.

Nous nous sommes développés à travers l'idée qu'une société de services a en réalité deux clients :
Le client final, qui bénéficie de l'expertise des consultants,
Le consultant, qui au fur et à mesure des missions acquiert de nouvelles compétences.
Pour réaliser cette idée, nous nous appuyons sur les valeurs suivantes :

Honnêteté et transparence :

Expertise : En plus des compétences sur différents outils du marché, nous apportons également à nos clients une expertise méthodologique forte dans le domaine de la BI.
Convivialité et esprit d'équipe : Nous entretenons un solide esprit d'équipe et d'entraide entre nos collaborateurs. Ceci permet aux consultants d'accroître leurs compétences, et aux clients de bénéficier de meilleures prestations.

D'avantage qu'une simple société de services, TRIMANE c'est, avant tout, la rencontre de personnes passionnées par leur métier qui ont envie d'avancer ensemble.

Nous recherchons aujourd'hui des consultants qui souhaitent nous faire partager leur expertise et s'investir dans une structure à taille humaine (95 personnes).

Contribuer à la gestion de carrières de vos équipes de consultants en participant à leurs entretiens annuels et aux suivis de missions,
Gérer votre activité commerciale via un outil CRM

Vous avez le goût pour les challenges et êtes doté d’une curiosité naturelle et vous présentez d’excellentes capacités d’expression orale et qualités orthographiques.

Position Description:
Fondé en 1976, Groupe CGI inc. est la cinquième plus importante entreprise indépendante de services en technologies de l'information et en gestion des processus d'affaires au monde.

Grâce à ses quelque 77 000 professionnels, CGI offre un portefeuille complet de services, y compris des services-conseils stratégiques en informatique et en management, des services d'intégration de systèmes, de développement et de maintenance d'applications informatiques, de gestion d'infrastructures technologiques ainsi qu'une vaste gamme de solutions exclusives à des milliers de clients à l'échelle mondiale à partir de ses bureaux et centres mondiaux de prestation de services dans les Amériques, en Europe et en Asie-Pacifique. Site Web : www.cgi.com.

CGI en France est le 4ème acteur indépendant en conseil et services en technologies de l'information réunissant 11 000 collaborateurs présents dans 22 villes.

Spécialisé autour des solutions CRM, BI et Digital Entreprise incontournables du marché, notre entité apporte son savoir-faire et ses retours d'expérience aux clients (Marketing Digital, Parcours de fidélisation, DMP, ETL, Data Quality, Data Mining, Big Data, progiciels de gestion intégrés, Digital Customer Experience, portails d'entreprise, CMS, mobilité, User eXperience, studio graphique et autres), en partenariat avec les principaux éditeurs du marché.

Your future duties and responsibilities:
Vous êtes passionné par le Décisionnel, le Big Data, et avez déjà une très solide expérience sur un ou plusieurs outils de Business Intelligence

Vous souhaitez diversifier vos compétences BI pour être toujours à la pointe des nouvelles technologies et souhaitez rejoindre une entité spécialisée dans la data ( > 120 consultants BI)

Vous souhaitez œuvrer dans des contextes technologiques variés, peu présents sur les bassins locaux (SAS, MicroStrategy, Cognos, Tableau, Datastage, Informatica, Talend, Hadoop, Hortonworks, Kafka, …)

Consultant BI expérimenté, vous intégrerez une équipe de collaborateurs CGI et participerez à toutes les phases de mise en œuvre d'un projet BI : de l'analyse du besoin client à la proposition et à la mise en place de la solution technique. Vous évoluerez sur des projets d'envergure, dans des environnements métiers variés avec un niveau de responsabilité élevé. Vous aurez également la possibilité de monter en compétences sur d'autres outils BI que votre domaine de compétences initial.

Dans un environnement technologique accompagnant la transformation digitale de nos clients grands comptes :

Intégration
Architecture d'entreprise
BI 2.0 / BigData
Scrum
Fort d'une intégration réussie, de nombreuses possibilités d'évolutions de carrière s'offriront rapidement à vous, dans l'animation de la filière technique, dans le consulting de solutions BI ou dans une fonction de Chef de Projet BI

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
Passionné de nouvelles technologies, vous aimez le travail en équipe, apprendre, partager, vous êtes également dotés d'un esprit audacieux et ambitieux.

De formation Bac+3 ou Bac+5, vous justifiez impérativement d'au moins 3 ans d'expérience professionnelle dans le consulting BI. Vous avez déjà de préférence évolué dans un contexte Agile (Scrum, DevOps, SAFe, ...). Vous justifiez également et si possible d'une pratique en tant que Consultant BI dans des projets en mode forfait.

Vous avez de bonnes capacités :
d'analyse
technique
d'innovation et de créativité
de rigueur
Votre dynamisme, votre ambition et votre goût du challenge sont vos atouts pour réussir dans ce poste. Votre envie de transmettre vos connaissances également.

Comme tous les postes de l'entreprise, ce poste est ouvert aux personnes en situation de handicap.

What you can expect from us:
Donnez un élan à votre carrière.

Le secteur des technologies de l'information (TI) connaît une période extraordinaire. La transformation numérique des organisations continue de s'accélérer, et CGI est au premier plan de ce changement. Nous accompagnons nos clients dans leur démarche numérique et offrons à nos professionnels des opportunités de carrière stimulantes.

La réussite de CGI repose sur le talent et l'engagement de nos professionnels. Ensemble, nous relevons les défis et partageons les bénéfices issus de la croissance de notre entreprise. Cette approche renforce notre culture d'actionnaire-propriétaire ainsi, tous nos professionnels bénéficient de la valeur que nous créons collectivement.

Joignez-vous à nous pour prendre part à la croissance de l'une des plus importantes entreprises indépendantes de services en technologies de l'information (TI) et en gestion des processus d'affaires au monde.

Pour en savoir davantage à propos de CGI : www.cgi.com.

Les candidatures non sollicitées provenant de cabinets de recrutement ne seront pas retenues.

Founded in 1981, ATR has become world leader on the market for regional aircraft with 90 seats or less. If you are interested in this position, please apply online.
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to ATR and Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by ATR and Airbus.

Description of the job :
Within Commercial Directorate, reporting to Head of Marketing Department, your main function will be to provide a thorough understanding of the regional air transport business, its characteristics and perspective, in order to anticipate future trends and requirements and to contribute actively to the commercial & product strategy of the company. By establishing a relevant expertise, contribute to the positive perception of ATR as a leader and best influence market development. In addition you will support the Head of department as required.

Task & accountabilities :
Lead a team of 5 experts to:
Influence the market by promoting regional connectivity and its benefits,
Stimulate market demand by modelling new routes and sharing results with airlines
Forecast: set up a market forecast model and deliver a 20-year market forecast
Analysis: provide support to sales effort by carrying out market studies, network analysis, contribute to product development strategy by estimating market potential,
Database: centralize and maintain Marketing database (MINT: Marketing Innovative Navigation Tool – schedule, traffic and fleet data, economic data, airports, Metars, google car road distance and time, ATR fleet history Maintenance Data) and provide relevant reporting to the company
Maintenance Cost: Annual update and deployment of DMC baseline by using the latest inputs from Program/Engineering, maintain DMC projection tool and operational expertise to ensure the most relevant maintenance costs projection is used in sales campaigns.
Marketing plan: provide market landscape supporting marketing & communication strategies, product and services strategies, implement associated roadmap with Head of Regions, communication and Program.
Establish long term planning and identification of targets and prospects in cooperation with each head of region
Market intelligence: develop and maintain a system to collect and consolidate information related to market trends, competition, maintenance cost drivers and market requirements to support product development.
Create meaningful messaging in collaboration with Communication Department
Conferences: promotion of ATR views to international audiences through preparation and presentations of ATR product range, market analysis and competitive advantages
Services Marketing: provide sales team with relevant marketing material referring to services provided by ATR contribute to Services development strategy by analysing market needs.

Required skills :
At least 5 years relevant professional experience is required ideally with Commercial or Operational role within an airline.
A solid operational and commercial understanding of the regional air transport business, airline cost structure, market dynamics,

Technical skills (5-6 key competences)
Aviation market key players, stakeholders, trends and drivers
Understanding of Macro-economic environment,
Aircraft financing landscape
Technology awareness
Airline fleet and network planning, revenue management
Data management and mathematical models
Product knowledge: good understanding
Marketing and communication: messaging, presentation

Language skills (and level)
A high standard of fluently spoken and written English compulsory the additional ability to communicate in French and other languages is desirable.

IT skills (tools)
Software: Excel, PowerPoint, World, PowerBI
Database: understanding of the following data : Schedule & traffic data (e.g. OAG, SABRE, MIDT), Macro-Economic data (e.g. IHS, Oxford Economics)

Soft skills:
Management: Capability to animate and federate the team around common objective.
Adaptability: capacity to adapt new topics (technical, commercial, communication, service, tools), conduct research and understand main drivers to elaborate guidance
Customers: Ability to work in order to satisfy internal and / or external clients managing time and quality expectations.
Economic impact: Ability to achieve objectives by integrating notions of time, quality and financial results.
Innovation: Ability to use a creative approach to create new marketing strategies, solve problems and achieve goals.
Excellent presentation style and skills experience in making presentation to a large audience and ability to communicate with different sources and users of information.
Ability to influence decisions, internally and externally.
Good writing skills, ability to prepare clear and concise reports.

Le site de Toulouse regroupe deux activités principales : l’une en charge de développer et commercialiser des solutions et équipements pour avions et hélicoptères (cockpits, solutions pour cabines, systèmes de missions civiles et militaires, et offres de services associées) ; l’autre , le centre d’Air Traffic Management (ATM), pôle d’expertise historique des systèmes de gestion du trafic aérien.
Dans le cadre de notre développement, nous recherchons un(e) Développeur(se) FullStack (H/F)
QUI ETES-VOUS ?
Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’un cursus universitaire scientifique ou ingénieur avec une spécialisation en informatique et/ou réseau ?
Vous maîtrisez plusieurs langages de développement (Go, Python, Java, Angular, React, Node JS …), vous permettant d’intervenir sur différentes stacks techniques et sans limitation back end / front end ?

Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre ouverture d’esprit, votre rigueur et votre prise d’initiative ?
Vous souhaitez travailler dans un environnement très collaboratif tout en restant autonome et en proposant vos idées pour améliorer les pratiques de votre équipe ?
Ce poste est fait pour vous !
CE QUE NOUS POUVONS ACCOMPLIR ENSEMBLE :
Thales a pour ambition de devenir un acteur incontournable et exemplaire du digital, et ce dans l’ensemble de ses marchés. Le programme de Transformation Digitale lancé par le groupe a pour objectif d’offrir aux clients de Thales des offres « best in class » et à ses propres employés de nouvelles méthodes de travail adaptées à leurs besoins, en s’appuyant sur des technologies et une culture digitales.
Pour accompagner cette transformation au sein de la Business Line FLX, le centre de compétence Digital (DCC) a été créé. Il a pour objectif d’apporter un support opérationnel aux Business Segment et s'articule autour de 3 axes :
1 - Développer les produits digitaux de FLX au travers de MVP (Minimum Viable Products)
2 - Maintenir & Opérer ces produits digitaux en réduisant le cycle de livraison Client
3 - Créer et animer une communauté de savoir-faire autour des technologies digitales clés (Connectivité, Cybersécurité, Big Data, Intelligence Artificielle, Architecture Cloud)
Au sein de votre squad Agile, vous vous verrez confier les missions suivantes :
Vous contribuez au design, à la conception et au développement de projets
Vous déployez au quotidien des projets sur une plateforme Cloud (Azure)
Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les membres de votre Squad et des équipes support et transverses (PO, architecte, Scrum Master, UX, UI) afin de mettre au point des solutions utilisateurs
Vous avez envie de participer à la transformation d’un grand groupe ? Alors rejoignez-nous !
Innovation, passion, ambition : rejoignez Thales et créez le monde de demain, dès aujourd’hui.

You will be instrumental in leading and delivering the transformation of the business through organisational change, leadership of People Business Partners and improvement in the People team's operations. You will strategically business partner with Directors specifically in relation to their departmental people needs.

The role
Strategic:
Collaborate with all Board Directors, Senior leaders, People Director and other key stakeholders to support you to evaluate, develop and deliver strategic and operational solutions in the Business Partnering and Operations team.
Use data and insights to inform development and evaluate of Business Partnering and operations strategies.
Advise Directors and leaders on the development of departmental strategies and plans, as they relate to their people.
Leadership:
Ensure that the Business Partner and Operations team deliver effective and efficient services and solutions that include excellent communication, proactive planning/project management and review of data and insights to measure success.
Continuously seek ways to improve the efficiency and performance of the Business Partnering and Operations team.
Evaluate the results and outcomes of the the Business Partnering and Operations team and take proactive action in maximising opportunities and addressing issues.
Full line management and leadership responsibility for the team( including reward decision), motivating, managing and developing the team to high performance and addressing any issues.
Ensuring the resources across the function (people, time and costs) are managed effectively and proactively.
Manage and monitor the budgets and costs set for the Business Partnering and operations function, ensuring that the service is delivered within financial targets set.
Evaluate, manage and monitor third party suppliers (i.e. HRIS, Payroll and occupational health etc), ensuring that they deliver cost effective services in line with SLA's and expectations. Address issues and identify opportunities to working in partnership for mutual benefit. Ensure that governance on the engagement of third party suppliers is adhered to by the function.
Organisational design & change:
Collaborate with Board Directors, senior leaders and people team colleagues.
Ensure that the team deliver effective organisational restructures and changes through: excellent communication and engagement, strong project management, sound legal advice and approaches that are pragmatic, fair and meet ACAS best practice.
Ensure that managers and leaders of change are fully trained, supported and coached on their role in leading the change process.
Inclusion:
Identify potential legal issues related to inclusions and resolve these through proactive management with People team.
Collaborate effectively with the Head of Employee Experience to create holistic Diversity and Inclusion strategy.
Deliver initiatives and events that foster an inclusive culture.
Business Partnering and Employee Relations:
Accountable for ensuring the companies policies and processes are legally compliant and aligned with our culture and strategic goals.
Lead team and enable managers and leaders to develop high performing teams, motivating and developing individuals whilst addressing performance and conduct actively and fairly.
Work with the People Business Partners to ensure they are effectively and fairly resolve employee relation issues including investigations, advising leaders chairing disciplinary and grievances, and all other potential employee relations cases that are not too highly complex.
Lead on the resolution of highly complex or high profile employee relation issues.
Payroll and Operations:
Accountable for the controls, governance and processing of the payroll.
Oversee payroll audits to ensure compliance and ensure that risks and learnings actively addressed in a timely manner. Ensure that the team adhere to the checks and controls required to meet our compliance, governance and audit needs.
Check and sign- off the monthly payroll within deadlines and ensure accuracy, effective and efficient- delivering against all legal, regulatory, HMRC and audit requirements.
Manage the Payroll and Benefits Partner, to ensure accuracy, efficiency and effectiveness.
Ensure that the People Administrator is managed and developed effectively to deliver all aspects of this critical role in an accurate, timely and effect way, including delivering against critical legal, regulatory and corporate requirements (right to work, referencing etc).
Identify opportunities to increase accuracy, efficiency and effectiveness of data, processes, systems and develop solutions to address these, liaising as necessary with team members and business stakeholders.
Lead the project management of the annual salary and bonus review process, ensuring the team deliver proactively against key actions. Liaise with the People Director and colleagues to ensure clear governance and audit trail from the board decision on pay approach to an individuals payment received and confirmation if this.

What are we looking for?

As our ideal candidate, you will be a CIPD qualified established Head of People, who has experience of setting the direction and developing effective holistic strategies with Business Partners and Operations function for business success.
Experience leading and fully line managing the strategy and operations of Business Partners and Operations function with professionals across business partnering and Payroll.
Experience selecting and closely managing third party suppliers within SLA's and expectations across payroll, business partnering and people operations.
Experienced in leading and effectively managing compliant payroll and operations function and experience of overseeing the teams delivery against audit requirements.
Excellent employment law knowledge and extensive experience of effectively making decisions - balancing legal, commercial, reputation and cultural needs of the business.
Extensive strategic business partnering experience across the business at board, and senior leadership levels delivering a proactive solution in a fast paced business, solid experience of using data and insights to deliver impactful solutions.
Extensive experience influencing, supporting and coaching Directors and senior leaders to deliver their strategic objectives, as they relate to people.
Strong numerical and commercial acumen and negotiation skills.
Experienced in successfully managing highly complex and high profile employee relations and organisational change, mitigating risks and issues effectively. Able to make sound judgements in the best interest of the business.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy and experienced in embedding compliance controls, checks and governance, including keeping up to date with legally required legal changes.
Excellent verbal, written communication and inter-personal skills; able to collaborate, influence, be assertive and flex style and approach dependant on the stakeholder.
Resilient, confident and high levels of emotional intelligence with ability to build strong and productive relationships inside and outside of the organisation; building trust through capability, credibility and confidence.
Fully compliant in using HRIS, Microsoft and other relevant systems.
High levels of integrity and confidentiality.
CIPD Qualified.

Why should you join our team?

Well there are a number of reasons to come on board our team of talented professionals, but here are just a few…
We are inclusive, fair and family friendly
We invest in the training and the development of our employees
We value and support our people and believe our people make the difference
We believe in building a diverse and inclusive culture and positive employee experience
We believe that diversity of thought, experience and background provides the platform for great creativity

We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. If you have a disability or any reasonable adjustment that requires accommodation, please contact us.

Description du poste :
Un poste de Responsable Portfolio Produits Renseignement GEOINT(h/f) vient de s'ouvrir au sein d’Airbus Defence & Space - à Toulouse. Vous rejoindrez l'équipe Program Portfolio management « TCIMP » « Products and Solutions », responsable de la gestion des produits, des solutions et des services qui sont développés au sein des programmes dans le domaine du renseignement.

Vous serez rattaché(e) à l’unité de programmes « TCI : Intelligence » qui propose un portefeuille complet dans le domaine de l'imagerie satellite, de produits C4ISR (Commandement, Contrôle, Communication, Calcul, Intelligence, Surveillance et Reconnaissance) et de services associés.

Au sein de cette unité, l'entité TCIM « Multi-INT » propose des systèmes d'information et de renseignement aux Forces armées et de sécurité du monde entier pour soutenir les opérations terre-air-mer. Elle conduit des projets, en France et à l'export, de déploiement de centres opérationnels Intelligence utilisant l'imagerie spatiale pour des domaines applicatifs variés, notamment celui du renseignement géo-spatial (GEOINT), d'Images Analyse (IMINT) ou tout autre composante (OSINT,
SIGINT...).. Au travers ces différents projets, Airbus Defence and Space a développé un portefeuille complet de produits et de solutions du renseignement « Multi-INT » répondant parfaitement aux besoins critiques des clients du secteur de la sécurité et de la défense.


Les solutions GEOINT sont basées sur la suite de produits Intelligence4Decision (I4D) qui a pour objectif de visualiser les différentes données fusionnées du renseignement sur un globe virtuel afin de fournir une information pertinente pour les activités d'analystes. La ligne de produits I4D comprend un Data Centre des solutions de fusion et de visualisation spatio-temporelle (I4D explorer et sa version web I4D-web) et un outil de commande, de programmation et de distribution d'images satellite (« DRS-Booster »)

Ce poste nécessite une habilitation de sécurité ou nécessite d'être éligible à une habilitation par les autorités reconnues.

Tâches et missions principales, responsabilités :
Vous serez responsable des activités principales suivantes :


Elaborer une stratégie produit,
Incarner les utilisateurs et les attentes clients,
Piloter les activités de product development,
Développer tout partenariat utile,
Créer les contenus utiles à la suite de produits I4D (présentation, prix, études...),
Définir les budgets R&D en lien avec un Business Case (opportunités business, model de coûts et de prix de licences) et de suivre ces dépenses R&D,
Concevoir le plan de développement à moyen et long termes de chaque produit en définissant une feuille de route (« roadmap ») en accord avec les activités vente et projets (nouvelles fonctionnalités)
Valider les incréments du produit développés en mode agile selon la feuille de route définie,
Positionner la suite de produits I4D au sein du Portfolio plus large de TCIMP,
Définir une conception générique et modulaire des produits afin d'optimiser sa réutilisation sur des projets futurs,
Livrer une expertise technique, fonctionnelle et financière sur le produit en phase d'avant-vente et lors des appels d'offres
Fournir un support technique et fonctionnel sur le produit auprès des clients et de l'équipe Marketing,
Valider les initiatives technologiques R&T et innovation internes en lien avec la feuille de route produit,

Compétences requises :
Vous avez la formation, les expériences et compétences suivantes :

Titulaire d’un diplôme d’ingénieur ou équivalent
Maitrise du métier de Portfolio / Product management (stratégie produits, élaboration de feuilles de route, gestion du cycle de vie d'un produit, support ventes et marketing)
Maitrise de la méthode agile et de la gestion de projets,
Expérience en GEOINT vivement appréciée, COMINT et OSINT seraient un plus,
Capacité à challenger des profils techniques et à appréhender des domaines, techniques et innovants,
Bonne communication interpersonnelle et orale,
Esprit d’équipe,
Orienté(e) satisfaction clients,
Capacité de négociation,
Niveau de négociation en français et en anglais. L’allemand serait un plus

Several vacancies for Full Stack Software Engineer (m/f) positions have arisen within Airbus Commercial Aircraft in Toulouse. You will join the Data Analytics team within Digital Transformation Office (DTO) organization.

The DTO leads the digital transformation of Airbus group, leading key digital initiatives, defining the group data strategy, and supporting culture change towards more digital and agile ways of working. The Artificial Intelligence and Analytics team is a central group of data scientists and AI experts within the DTO. The team’s mission is to lead the most valuable and challenging data science and artificial intelligence projects across multiple domains, developing rapid prototypes and early-stage products to solve applied problems in all areas of the business.

As a Full Stack Software Engineer (m/f), you will play a key role in growing proof of concepts and prototypes into mature, shippable products. You will be responsible for developing software with a diverse development team in a fast paced environment, following agile best practices.

Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:

o Developing and deploying scalable software in a rapid prototyping, agile context.
o Working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with a multi-functional product team, sharing in application development tasks
o Developing design specifications and parameters that comply with the infrastructure and security requirements
o Applying a good theoretical understanding of complexity theory and distributed computing to practical problems
o Collaborating closely with product owners and technical team members to deliver optimal solutions
o Accelerating the development workflow and productivity with tools, systems and processes
o Maintaining codebases to develop a robust and maintainable software stack
o Evangelizing modern software engineering practices within the team

This role will involve some travel for business and as such, you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :

o Interest in the entire product design and development process
o Problem solver: solving technical problems with a variety of methods
o Hands on approach: willing to get involved in a variety of tasks and roles to deliver working products
o Self starter: takes initiative and proactive approach
o Interest in emerging technologies
o You will have the following skills and experience:
o Significant experience of building scalable software in an agile environment. Experience working in a startup environment would be preferable.
o Backend Languages
mandatory: JVM-based or C++, Python
optional: Go, Node.js

mandatory: Angular or React
optional: Vue.js
o DevOps Concepts such as containerization, CI/CD, application performance management
o Ways of working such as agile methodologies and modern software engineering practices
o Niche Skills, for example Stream Processing, Reactive Programming
o Language Skills: advanced level of English, French or German would be a plus

Synthetic, rigorous and curious

Advanced level of English

Titre: Internship - New Maintenance Product Line – Benefits and Per...
Descriptif_du_poste:
Toulouse (31)
Temps plein, Stage
Airbus Operations SAS
Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2018 it generated revenues of € 64 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Airbus offers the most comprehensive range of passenger airliners. Airbus is also a European leader providing tanker, combat, transport and mission aircraft, as well as one of the world's leading space companies. In helicopters, Airbus provides the most efficient civil and military rotorcraft solutions worldwide.

Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place. Taking pride in our work, we draw on each other's expertise and experience to achieve excellence. Our diversity and teamwork culture propel us to accomplish the extraordinary - on the ground, in the sky and in space.
Job Description
What if YOU starts your journey with US!
As part of a school curriculum in initial training, you are looking for a mandatory internship or integrated into a gap year that will allow you to validate your studies. The internship duration is 4 to 6 months maximum.
We are looking for a New Maintenance Product Line Engineer who will be joining us at Airbus site in Toulouse.
This internship is to be filled from 6th of January.
You will be joining the department « Maintenance & Data Operations » whose mission is to Create, Design, Develop Maintenance and Data operations to:
Boost Aircraft Availability
Ease Maintenance Operations
Promote Innovation & Services
Maximize the Value of Data
Ensure Data Availability
The objective of the internship is to define the benefits and perspectives of our future Maintenance Product Line.
Tasks and Responsibilities :
You will be working under the supervision of your manager who will help you identify your professional objectives and support you in the development of your skills.
Your main activities will include:
Analysis of the competition (Boeing/Bombardier/ATR/…)
Analysis of opportunities linked to new techno (artificial intelligence, block chain, …) and scientific literature on the domain
Based on different architectures proposed by the teams, assessment of :
Operational and business value for airlines
Business value for Airbus: ability to make services / reduce costs
Based on business value and Airbus product strategy, define a roadmap for implementation.
Required skills:
You are preparing a diploma level Bac+ 5, in Aeronautics or equivalent, with specialization in Economy or Business management and you obtain following competences:
English: ADVANCE level
French: ADVANCE level
You have a customer mindset.
You are dynamic, positive, curious, passionate and creative.
You like to learn and to collaborate with a high diversity of people.
Depending on the specifics of the offer, you may have to travel to another locations.
If your profile catches our attention, you will be invited to perform a video interview during which you will have a few minutes to tell us about your background, motivations and your professional project. Afterwards, your application could be proposed to the managers for further review.
If the prospect of joining our innovative Group motivates you do not hesitate and apply online on our website www.airbus.com/careers!

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.
