Description of the job :
Two vacancies for Data Scientists (m/f) have arisen within Airbus Commercial Aircraft in Toulouse. You will join the 'Analytics Accelerator' department within Digital Transformation Office (DTO) organization.

The Digital Transformation Office leads the digital transformation of Airbus group, leading key digital initiatives, defining the group data strategy, and supporting culture change towards more digital and agile ways of working.

The Analytics Accelerator is a central group of data scientists in the DTO. Its mission is to lead the most valuable and challenging data science projects across all parts of the business. It also helps to build up data science expertise the organization and pioneers new ways of working.

As a Data Scientist (m/f) you will play a pivotal role in ensuring that the data science expertise in the Analytics Accelerator is employed effectively and efficiently. Among other things, that will include supporting the operational running of the team, project portfolio management and valuation, and communications.

The role will be to lead and implement data science projects as part of a rapidly growing and evolving team that works at the cutting-edge of applied data science. The team has a large degree of autonomy and high visibility to top management. The role offers a challenging and exciting personal environment as well as the opportunity to grow within the DTO and Airbus.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:
o Scoping, leading, and executing data science projects (incl. stakeholder management and communications)
o Performing hands-on work to build integrated data sets, analyse data sources (ML/AI), and build compelling visualizations (typically Python, R, Spark)
o Providing technical advice on analytics projects
o Visualising and communicating results (e.g. in interactive dashboards)
o Presenting results to project stakeholders, including business experts and middle management
o Sharing knowledge, contribute to driving change within the digital network, presentations and communications within the digital community, dissemination of best practices (patterns), etc.

This role will involve some travel for business and as such, you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :
We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:

o At least early-level career experience
o Proven experience (mandatory)
Leading and executing data science projects
Project management experience: deliver a concrete result to a customer
Experience understanding, structuring, and integrating data (e.g., fields, data quality, ranges, volume, etc.)
Significant experience using inferential statistics / machine learning (e.g. statistical testing, clustering, PCA, SVM, random forests, regression, neural networks)
o Additional desirable knowledge / experience
Optimization/operational research experience (modelling and development)
Understanding of big data system architectures (e.g., HDFS, Spark)
Experience working with unstructured data (e.g. text, images, video)
o Knowledge / understanding
Digital technologies and related challenges
Ability to understand business processes and build up business cases
Desirable: Aerospace business experience (product and service portfolio)
o Tools
Significant working experience one or more of the following languages: R, Python, Java, Matlab, Spark ...
Experience using data visualization tools (e.g. RShiny, Spotfire, Tableau)
o Languages
Fluent written and spoken English
Desirable: French or German and other European languages
o Business travel: Limited travel within Europe (few days per month)

Especially:

o Structured and self-organised way of working
o Strong communicator towards diverse audiences (incl. senior management) and strong networking skills
o Hands-on, pragmatic approach to building digital products (hacker / entrepreneurial mind-set)
o Team player: Collaborative mind-set and ways of working
o Comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment, personal resilience to challenge status quo
o Curiosity for data and data-driven decisions, interest in business or industrial problem solving, creativity

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a Solution Architect/Data Scientist has arisen within Airbus in Toulouse within the Extended Enterprise (EE) team in ZIMTS.

The EE can be best described as a collaborative network of partners (such as business, IM contributors, subcontractors, and suppliers) involved in the design, development, production, delivery and support of a product (like an Aircraft or Information System), and its associated services. Our role at ZIMTS is to facilitate that network of partners to achieve its goals.

Our goal is to completely redesign the experience with the EE in terms of processes and tools, using innovating new ways of working (Design thinking, Lean Startup, Agile development) and the latest infrastructure and security technologies. You will have the opportunity to contribute and/or lead product design and development depending on your role. We are at the forefront of providing bleeding edge solutions that replaces our previous centralized access model.

We aim to leverage EE IM solutions with respect to the Airbus digital transformation e.g. Move to Cloud, Skywise, Google Suite, all aiming to secure Airbus’ objectives for single aisle ramp-up.

We are looking for professionals motivated to learn and develop new skills. Based on your experience and career goals you will have the opportunity to work either as a Product Owner or Solution Architect.

You will partner with suppliers and Airbus businesses and contribute to the strategy and vision for future collaboration across Extended Enterprise partners. We offer you career development, empowerment, autonomy and to work closely with the Business.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:

Being responsible for data driven company strategy implementation within the team
Ensure the end-to-end product lifecycle and roadmap of solutions, determine product strategy and drive the delivery of the solution.
Participate to a team to ensure the product / service lifecycle meets quality and service commitments.
Lead the delivery of functional and conceptual architecture design for Extended Enterprise related projects intended for worldwide use.
Work jointly with Airbus internal Customers and Suppliers to determine what IT/IS solutions are required to enable integration into Airbus.
Delivers consistent and efficient architecture across products and secure integration across full portfolio by guiding solution decisions.

This role will involve some travel for business “averaging two a month” in Europe and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :
You will have some or all of the following skills and experience:

Ideally educated to Master or PhD degree level (or equivalent) in IM or demonstrated passion for information technology
Experience as Data Scientist
Strong communication skills and plays well with others.
Stakeholder engagement.
Innovative and creative thinker.
Entrepreneurial mindset.
Demonstrates experience on following Product Owner and Architecture capabilities at least one aptitude for learning.
o Experience as an Architect / Product Owner
o Project Management (from Waterfall to SAFE/AGILE)
Language Skills: Advanced level of English.

Descriptif_du_poste:
For our Toulouse site, we are looking for a :
Group Leader – In Vitro Biology- Oncology (M/F)
TASKS :
Under the responsability of the head of the « In Vitro Biology » department, you will be in charge of the following tasks :
Play a key scientific role in multiple projects in the field of oncology by participating in or leading cross-functional research projects and by maintaining a cutting edge awareness of technical developments and scientific knowledge to improve project performance
Manage a group consisting of skilled scientists consisting of team leaders, masters’ level and technicians, while collaborating in a multidisciplinary, fast-paced discovery-oriented environment, and at the interface of several departments and sites.
Successfully present Evotec externally to potential new clients and collaborators in In Vitro pharmacology and/or integrated drug discovery projects.
Be responsible for supporting existing activities as well as establishing novel In Vitro assays, know-how and capabilities within the In Vitro department at Evotec Toulouse in response to new business opportunities, working efficiently with other scientists within the company and/or external platforms
PROFILE :
Autonomous, pro-active, flexible and a motivating leader
Rigorous, innovative and knowledgable
Dynamic and customer focused
EDUCATION :
Minimum a PhD
EXPERIENCE :

At least 5 years pharmaceutical industry, biotech and/or CRO experience required
Records and accomplishments in drug discovery project management with clients/partners is required
COMPETENCES :
A proven background in in vitro pharmacology and drug discovery with a track record of contributing to the delivery of pre-clinical development candidates

L’Institut de Recherche Technologique Antoine de Saint Exupéry, vise à renforcer la compétitivité de la recherche et de l’industrie en Occitanie, Nouvelle Aquitaine et Provence-Alpes-Côte d’Azur dans les secteurs de l’aéronautique, du spatial, et des systèmes embarqués.
Financé à 50% par le secteur public et à 50% par le secteur privé, il réunit les grands industriels de la région des secteurs concernés, les établissements publics et leurs laboratoires pour travailler dans trois domaines technologiques stratégiques : matériaux multifonctionnels haute performance, aéronef plus électrique, systèmes embarqués.
Dans le cadre de son développement, l’IRT recherche 3 Data Scientists (F/H).
Ces postes sont, dans un premier temps, des C.D.D. de 16 mois, mais peuvent déboucher sur des CDI dans le cadre des projets I.A. de l’IRT Saint Exupéry.
Mission :
Le profil recherché de data scientist possède une formation doctorante en Mathématiques appliquées, Statistique ou Data science. Des connaissances en Météorologie seront un plus. Le travail demandé se fera en étroite collaboration avec deux autres data scientist et un ingénieur de recherche. Chaque data scientist aura personnellement en charge les recherches et développement liés à l’un des lots de travail défini dans ce projet, sous la direction du ou des responsables scientifiques. La collaboration avec les autres lots du projet permettra une synergie des compétences et savoirs, ainsi qu’une émulation scientifique et technique.
Le projet est découpé en trois lots couvrant une large gamme de phénomènes météorologiques et d’échéances de prévision :
– Lot 1 : Adaptation Statistique a posteriori des prévisions météorologiques par des méthodes d’apprentissage profond – responsables scientifiques : Brendan Guillouet (IRT), Olivier Mestre (Météo-France)
Dans le cadre de ce lot, vos missions principales seront :
– implémenter l’adaptation statistique (c’est-à-dire l’apprentissage des corrections statistiques des prévisions issues de modèles de prévision numérique du temps) par des réseaux convolutifs profonds afin de tirer parti de caractéristiques spatio-temporelles, dans le but de proposer une meilleure prévision que la prévision issue d’un modèle de prévision numérique. Les résultats obtenus seront comparés à ceux obtenus par des méthodes éprouvées de machine learning. Le cas envisagé pour ce projet concerne la prévision de nébulosité pour les opérateurs satellitaires.
– par ailleurs, en exploitant les données prévues et observées, les prévisionnistes résument les situations météorologiques à travers la description graphique des phénomènes atmosphériques d’intérêt (nuages, fronts, zones précipitantes,…). Vous étudierez l’apport du Deep Learning pour construire rapidement une telle description synthétique des objets météorologiques pertinents avec une exploration automatique de l’ensemble massif des données météorologiques disponibles.
– Lot 2 : Apprentissage profond pour améliorer la prévision climatique aux échelles (intra-)mensuelles et Prévisions Immédiates (PI) de situations orageuses par le suivi du déplacement d’une ligne d’orage – responsables scientifiques : Laurent Terray et Jean-Christophe Jouhaud (CERFACS)
Dans le cadre de ce lot, vos missions principales seront :
– l’hybridation a priori des modèles physiques de prévision du climat et des méthodes d’apprentissage profond (8 mois)
La compréhension et la prévision des phénomènes climatiques aux échelles mensuelles et intra-mensuelles reposent sur l’intégration de modèles physiques qui doivent recourir à des paramétrisation physiques pour pallier à leur manque de résolution spatiale et simuler les processus comme la convection atmosphérique et les nuages. Ces paramétrisations, imparfaites, peuvent avoir un impact négatif sur les processus à l’origine de la prévisibilité climatique aux échelles précitées. L’apprentissage profond, basé sur des jeux d’observation ayant fait l’objet de provisions rétrospectives, constitue une méthode très prometteuse pour essayer d’améliorer les scores de prévisibilité aux échelles (intra-)mensuelle et la compréhension des processus associés.
– l’apprentissage automatique pour capturer la physique du problème et inférer des modèles de correction (8 mois)
Les modèles de PNT sont peu adaptés aux prévisions à très courte échéance (jusqu’à quelques heures), à cause du temps de calcul requis pour leur résolution numérique et des approximations introduites par les paramétrisations physiques et l’incertitude sur les conditions initiales, particulièrement gênantes pour la prévision à très court terme. Les PI reposent donc sur des modèles plus simples œuvrant à extrapoler le futur proche à partir des observations les plus récentes. Vous exploiterez des approches probabilistes, connues sous le terme de Modèles Réduits pour la PI de situations orageuses. Ils seront élaborés via l’hybridation de modèles réduits (Krigeage) avec des méthodes d’apprentissage automatique (supervisé ou non-supervisé) sur la base des prévisions du modèle AROME et des observations radar de précipitations

– Lot 3 : Prévisions Immédiates (PI) de situations orageuses par le suivi du déplacement d’une ligne d’orage – responsable scientifique : Mathieu Serrurier (CIMI)
Dans le cadre de ce lot, vos missions principales seront :
– à partir d’un large jeu de données, faisant figurer l’ensemble des conditions initiales connues au moment de la prévision et les conditions réellement observées sur les prochaines heures, vous évaluerez la capacité des méthodes d’apprentissage profond à produire directement des prévisions à très court terme, sans avoir recours à un modèle atmosphérique. Ces modèles pourront à la fois prendre en compte les mesures des stations avoisinantes, mais aussi leur évolution temporelle (à l’aide de réseaux profonds récursifs).
– les réseaux profonds nécessitent l’apprentissage d’un nombre très élevé de paramètres, si bien qu’il est extrêmement difficile de comprendre la logique interne de décision et d’en extraire une synthèse intelligible pour un humain. Néanmoins, il est possible, à travers des analyses de sensibilité, de restituer dans certains cas de figure des structures sous-jacentes apprises par le réseau et leur imbrication logique en vue d’une décision et de déterminer quelles sont les variables qui ont eu le plus d’impact pour une prévision donnée. Pour notre projet, l’enjeu sera par exemple de modéliser certaines des situations météorologiques propices à un biais important des modèles atmosphériques.

Profil :
Titulaire d’un doctorat en Mathématiques appliquées, Statistique ou Data science, des connaissances en Météorologie seraient un plus.
Vous avez de solides connaissances en mathématiques de l’aléatoire. Vous disposez d’une première expérience dans la mise en œuvre de librairies de machine learning et/ou de deep learning, et possédez une bonne connaissance pratique du langage Python.

Si cette offre vous intéresse, merci d’adresser votre dossier de candidature (LM+CV) à recrutement@irt-saintexupery.com sous la référence : 18PD-SE-DEEP-01
il y a 30+ jours

Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2018 it generated revenues of € 64 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Job Description
Contact :
Please apply on line for this vacancy on our careers website (https://www.airbus.com/careers.html) with your CV and cover letter attached.

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Description of the job :
A vacancy for an Airline scientist (m/f) position has arisen within Airbus Commercial Aircraft in Toulouse. You will join the Airline Sciences team within the Digital Transformation Office (DTO).

The DTO (Digital Transformation Office) leads the digital transformation of Airbus group, leading key digital initiatives, defining the group data strategy, and supporting culture change towards more digital and agile ways of working.

Using scientific methods for operational knowledge, Airline sciences provide novel insights on the airline business environment, connecting our product to market reality and creating new business opportunities for Airbus.

Task & accountabilities :
As an Airline scientist (m/f), your main tasks and responsibilities will be to:

o Ensure ongoing development and support for the Airline Simulation tool by:
providing technical subject matter expertise in the development, maintenance, functionality and use of Airline simulation
responding to user requirements / business needs by releasing regular updates
coordinating and maintaining data source compatibility with Airbus Marketing, Design Office and external vendors

o Drive continuous innovation and forward thinking using latest technology, expertise and research by:
setting strategic direction for innovation through the phases of initiation, development, and implementation
playing a key role in driving the research, implementation and execution of multi-domain optimization
keeping up with industry direction and developments in the field of optimization and development
providing strategic input in support of Airbus sales campaigns and future aircraft design
maintaining relationships with local universities and research institutes to initiate and coordinate research initiatives
coordinating new innovation initiatives with internal business units
driving the development of analytical and optimizing tools that will assist in finding cost effective methods of analysing aircraft capability on existing and future network that will generate the most profit both for Airbus and its customers.

o Subject Matter Expert for Engineering Field of Expertise by:
providing guidance and technical assistance in the field of airline Flight Operations, Flight Planning, Route and Aircraft Evaluation

o People Management by:
motivating, developing and mentoring staff or university work experience students
providing appropriate and timely performance feedback
demonstrating emotional intelligence and maturity



This role will involve some travel for business in Europe and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :
We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:

o Professional Engineering - degree qualified. PhD preferred.
o Airline experience is a must, particularly in the field of Airline Flight Operations, Airline Fleet Planning and Aircraft Evaluation.
o Ability to influence outcomes and lead a team of professional engineers and university students in engineering research projects.
o Ability to work closely and effectively with people at all levels in the company including Design Office, Maintenance Services, Flight Operations, Strategy & Finance, Supply Chain, Marketing, Airworthiness Authorities, Air Navigation Service Providers, Suppliers, external customers and local University research associates.
o Sound written and verbal communication skills, including delivery of presentations on behalf of company to external stakeholders (Airlines & regulatory authorities and other government agencies) with strong commercial acumen & analytical skills
o Negotiation level of English.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Titre: Computational Chemist in Protein Molecular Dynamics
Descriptif_du_poste:
We are seeking for a highly motivated and innovative Scientist with a strong expertise in molecular dynamics of protein complexes, and biological simulations :
“Computational Chemist in Protein Molecular Dynamics – 18 months Temporary Contract“
Within the Research Informatics department, He/she will be responsible for:
Exploring innovative modes of action of proteins, including allostery, with molecular dynamics (MD) techniques.
Developing and validating prediction algorithms for the identification of candidate areas in proteins for non-orthostheric modulation, like cryptic pockets, protein-protein interaction sites.
He/she will have the following missions:
Provide structure-based support to projects and realize key contributions to milestones.
Explore, create, and develop methods for the identification of protein pockets, segments, and domains, for non-orthostheric modulation.
Perform research on original computational modeling and simulation methods for innovative therapeutic biomolecular modulation.
Incorporate Machine Learning approaches in the computational workflow.
Collaborate with computational chemists, bioinformaticians, biologists, structural biologists, and omics scientists in collaborative project teams.
Keep up-to-date with relevant professional literature and share methods and techniques with computational chemistry and project colleagues.
Write and contribute to publications and patents where possible.
Participate to the scientific life of the Computational Chemistry Group, and Evotec
Knowledge, skills and abilities :
Expertise in molecular dynamics of protein complexes, and biological simulations.
Experience of methods and techniques used in molecular biosimulations : e.g. enhanced MD, accelerated MD, steered MD, umbrella sampling, replica exchange, normal modes, multiscale modeling, Monte Carlo simulation, structural clustering
Excellent knowledge of at least one MD package: Amber, Gromacs, NAMD
Knowledge of protein structures, protein dynamics, protein-protein and protein-ligand interactions and simulation. Good knowledge of signal membrane proteins.
Explicit simulation of membrane proteins
Experience in developing and implementing molecular modeling algorithms to study protein complexes.
Knowledge of machine learning approaches for data mining.
Scripting experience, e.g. Python
Scientific rigor and excellent analytical and synthetic capabilities.
Ability to establish, to maintain effective working relationships, and to work collaboratively.
Strong communication skills.
Dynamic person with passion for innovation.
Written and spoken English
Experience and education :
PhD in a relevant scientific discipline : Computational Chemistry, Computational Biophysics, Structural Biology or equivalent
Minimum of 2 years post-doctoral academic or industrial experience in related activity
Publications in molecular dynamics of protein complexes and innovative methods to decipher protein dynamics and interactions.

NXP Semiconductors N.V. enables secure connections for a smarter world, advancing solutions that make lives easier, better, and safer. Key words : développement logiciel, IA, machine learning, data scientist, prédistorsion digitale, 5G RF
Contexte
Le département Radio Power Solution, basé à NXP Toulouse, en charge du développent et du test de produits radio fréquence pour la téléphonie 5G recrute un stagiaire de fin d’étude sur une durée de 6 mois afin de participer à mise en place d’un logiciel de banc de test RF utilisant des techniques de machine learning pour linéariser de façon optimale un transistor de puissance RF.
Vos Missions
Le(a) stagiaire prendra en charge/réalisera les missions suivantes :
Effectuer un travail de data scientist et réaliser la constitution d’une base de donnée qualifiée de mesures de linéarité RF, obtenues à partir d' algorithmes traditionnels de recherche opérationnelle pour déterminer un modèle de transistor de puissance adéquat pour la pré-distorsion digitale.
Participation à l’utilisation de l’IA (machine learning) pour dépasser ces limites.

Connaissances et ou expérience en programmation Matlab, électronique Radio fréquence, algorithmes de recherche opérationnelles, machine learning, techniques de pré-distorsion digitale.
Un bon niveau d’anglais est exigé.
Engineer Internship : IA software development for 5G RF digital predistortion
Target domain : RF division
Key words : Software development, IA, machine learning, Digital-predistorsion, 5G RF
Context
NXP Radio power solution department , located in Toulouse France, in charge of the development and test of RF products for the 5G telecom market, hire an engineer intern for a 6 months duration, to participate to the design of a RF test software using machine learning technics to linearize RF power amplifiers.
Responsibilities
The intern will contribute to the following missions
As a data scientist the intern should create a qualified database of RF linearity measurements, obtained on RF test bench thanks to legacy operational research type of algorithms used to determine the RF power amplifier model suitable for RF linearization
Research the limits of legacy algorithms
Potentially create upgraded algorithms based on machine learning technics.
Your profile :
Bac + 5, last year internship of french « école d’ingénieur » in computer science with telecom and, or IA specialty.
Knowledge or experience in matlab programming, RF electronic, operational research algorithms, machine learning, digital predistortion is required.
Good English level is mandatory.

Titre: DDMS Industrial System senior data scientist (m/f)
Descriptif_du_poste:
AIRBUS SAS
Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2018 it generated revenues of € 64 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Airbus offers the most comprehensive range of passenger airliners. Airbus is also a European leader providing tanker, combat, transport and mission aircraft, as well as one of the world's leading space companies. In helicopters, Airbus provides the most efficient civil and military rotorcraft solutions worldwide.

Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place. Taking pride in our work, we draw on each other's expertise and experience to achieve excellence. Our diversity and teamwork culture propel us to accomplish the extraordinary - on the ground, in the sky and in space.
Job Description
Contact :
Please apply on line for this vacancy on line at our careers site (www.jobs.airbus.com) with your CV and cover letter attached.

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a DDMS Industrial System senior data scientist (m/f) has arisen within Airbus in Toulouse.

You will join the Industrial System Design and Modelling Center of Competence for Airbus Commercial within multicultural environment.
Do you have a passion for manufacturing and have expertise in data science?
Have you experienced the power of data science in industrial environment?
Are you interested in leading digital transformation in a high-performance motivated team to deliver industry 4.0?
As Industrial Senior Data scientist in Airbus Commercial you will shape our Advanced Analytics journey for Industrial performance purpose.
You will have the opportunity to work on exciting technologies journey within Aeronautics industry leader.

Are you ready to take the challenge?

Then take the chance and apply now for the next step in your career!

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:

Define Data analytics, AI, ML strategy for Industrial performance analysis and prediction (Architecture, Roadmap, technical solutions, competences).
Define Data architecture, data requirements to define Multi-Modal information access for Industrial (from row data to smart data).
Develop, test and validate the advance analytics models (Model Reduction, Clusters Algorithms, Learnings Algorithms...).
Build integrated data sets, analyse data sources (ML/AI), and build compelling visualizations (typically Python, R, Spark) to create Industrial Digital Twin and Industrial Digital Shadow.
Create appropriate documentation and knowledge transfer materials to ensure effective, efficient and safe model implementation and integration into MBSE ecosystem.
Drive and deliver specific data analysis requested by Industrial system Engineer
Advise industrial community.
Creating best practices by delivering demonstrators, pilots and serial deployment for Industrial using current and future toolset.
Identifying current or future skill gaps in the frame of Industrial MBSE and derive and address adequate actions.

This role will involve frequent travel for business twice month) in Europe and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :
You will have the following skills and experience:

Educated to Master's degree in computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, data management, information systems, information science or equivalent.
The ideal candidate will have a combination of IT skills, data governance skills, analytics skills and industrial Engineering knowledge with a technical or computer science degree.
At least 3 years of experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in Industrial in support of a departmental and/or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative.
A deep understanding and proven experience with advanced analytics techniques and applications in Industrial Environment within MBSE environment.
Significant experience using inferential statistics / machine learning (e.g. statistical testing, clustering, PCA, SVM, random forests, regression, neural networks).
Proficient programming skills in at least two of the following: Python, Spark and/or Hadoop R, Java.
Experience delivering within one of the sub-domains of analytics, such as machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistical analysis (GLM, Bayesian Models, Non-Parametric Models, etc...).
Experience with Hadoop stack and Big Data tools. Experience with time series is a plus.
Experience in data visualization using open source and commercial tools.
Six Sigma Black Belt certification (or in progress).

Strong interpersonal skills, with an emphasis on the ability to effectively influence others, and a collaborative approach are a must.
A team-focused mentality with the proven ability to work effectively with diverse stakeholders.
An ability to communicate complex and technical issues to diverse audiences, orally and in writing, in an easily-understood, authoritative, and actionable manner.

Language Skills: negotiation level of English.

The position has been graded BVA- BVB

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Description of the job :
Several vacancies for Full Stack Software Engineer (m/f) positions have arisen within Airbus Commercial Aircraft in Toulouse. You will join the Data Analytics team within Digital Transformation Office (DTO) organization.

The DTO leads the digital transformation of Airbus group, leading key digital initiatives, defining the group data strategy, and supporting culture change towards more digital and agile ways of working. The Artificial Intelligence and Analytics team is a central group of data scientists and AI experts within the DTO. The team’s mission is to lead the most valuable and challenging data science and artificial intelligence projects across multiple domains, developing rapid prototypes and early-stage products to solve applied problems in all areas of the business.

As a Full Stack Software Engineer (m/f), you will play a key role in growing proof of concepts and prototypes into mature, shippable products. You will be responsible for developing software with a diverse development team in a fast paced environment, following agile best practices.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:

o Developing and deploying scalable software in a rapid prototyping, agile context.
o Working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with a multi-functional product team, sharing in application development tasks
o Developing design specifications and parameters that comply with the infrastructure and security requirements
o Applying a good theoretical understanding of complexity theory and distributed computing to practical problems
o Collaborating closely with product owners and technical team members to deliver optimal solutions
o Accelerating the development workflow and productivity with tools, systems and processes
o Maintaining codebases to develop a robust and maintainable software stack
o Evangelizing modern software engineering practices within the team

This role will involve some travel for business and as such, you must be able to travel accordingly.

Required skills :
You will have the following skills and mindset:

o Interest in the entire product design and development process
o Problem solver: solving technical problems with a variety of methods
o Hands on approach: willing to get involved in a variety of tasks and roles to deliver working products
o Self starter: takes initiative and proactive approach
o Interest in emerging technologies
o You will have the following skills and experience:
o Significant experience of building scalable software in an agile environment. Experience working in a startup environment would be preferable.
o Backend Languages
mandatory: JVM-based or C++, Python
optional: Go, Node.js
o Frontend Frameworks
mandatory: Angular or React
optional: Vue.js
o DevOps Concepts such as containerization, CI/CD, application performance management
o Ways of working such as agile methodologies and modern software engineering practices
o Niche Skills, for example Stream Processing, Reactive Programming
o Language Skills: advanced level of English, French or German would be a plus

Descriptif_du_poste:
Un de nos client vient de créer un datalake conséquent et souhaite industrialiser la mise à disposition de datasets 'à la demande' afin d'alimenter les équipes métiers et leurs data scientists.

Dans ce cadre, nous recherchons un data engineer dont la mission va être de créer l'interface d'extraction des datasets. Ces datasets représentent un actif majeur de l'entreprise. Une gouvernance leur est dédiée. Leur sécurité et leur qualité en sont deux enjeux majeurs à prendre en compte dans le choix et l'implémentation de la solution retenue.
Profil recherché Encadré par un data scientist expérimenté, et par un chef de projet fonctionnel, vous automatiser les activités de data engineering dans une démarche DevOps.

Outils/technos à maitriser:
Cloudera / Hive
ETL Talend
SQL
Unix
Jenkins / Travis (important)
Plus généralement:
Elaborer la stratégie de tests et la piloter, en collaboration avec les autres membres de l’équipe

Organiser et mettre en œuvre les tests pour tous les Use Cases

Coordonner les activités de test.

Contribuer à améliorer les processus de test, avec la mise en place des processus d’automatisation des tests

Evaluer la qualité des Use Cases en travaillant sur les tests de validation et les critères d’acceptation

Estimer les coûts des tests pour les User Stories

Participer à toutes les phases du développement des Use Cases (cadrage, exploration, industrialisation) et exécuter les cas de test

Identifier les outils disponibles et choisir ceux qui seront le mieux adaptés au contexte des projets Data (développement et production de Use Cases)

Elaborer la documentation et la partager

Assurer la montée en compétences et le partage de connaissances/retours d’expérience au sein des équipes agiles.

Contribution à l’élaboration du Value Proposition Canvas
Entreprise Chez DataPy, nous pensons que la vie des utilisateurs est facilitée quand les entreprises qui leur apportent des services utilisent bien leurs données et les intègrent dans des applications bien designées.

Nous pensons que les développeurs et les consultants qui construisent ces services le font d’autant mieux qu’ils trouvent du sens dans leur travail et peuvent se réaliser dans un cadre bienveillant.

C’est pourquoi chez DataPy, nous leur offrons la possibilité de se former, les jeudi matin, à des technologies avancées, et construisons avec eux le parcours vers leur prochain emploi.

Senior Backend Developer (f/m/x)
Location: Tettnang

Position summary
Avira is one of the leading providers of IT security solutions. As one of the pioneers in this field it has been present in the security software market for more than 30 years. At its headquarter in Tettnang near Lake Constance, it is one of the largest regional employers. Go beyond Antivirus with us and become a developer in our Protection Unit that contributes to the Avira Vision "Protecting People in the Connected World"!

As a Senior Developer (f/m/x) you will lead, design and implement new backend systems and architectures. You will be part of a cross functional team of open-minded computer scientists, located in Germany and Romania. While doing so, we expect you to use the existing knowledge and open atmosphere of the team in an agile environment and bring in your own ideas and improvements. Your ideas will be used as input to take Avira’s new detection technologies to the next level.

If you have an interest in working with the newest technologies and writing awesome code, we want to talk to you.

Your responsibilities
Starting from day one you will familiarize yourself with our vision for the backend systems we want to leverage to protect our customers. Within one month you understand the software and hardware architecture of the existing backend systems so you can start improving and deploying new components.
Within the first six months you will develop and implement new features that improve Avira’s cloud-based detection systems. The systems you design and develop will scale easily for very large amounts of data and will provide high performance while requiring low maintenance. Your projects will collect and process security-related intelligence and will then provide that data to the company as a whole so Avira can protect its users on a global scale.
Within the first year you will be truly integrated within a team that delivers the most up-to-date web-security solutions to our millions of customers. You take full ownership of cross-department projects and collaborate efficiently with other teams. You are keen to improve existing technology and implement new and innovative features. You also play a big part in securing and supporting the digital lifestyle of our customers and making the Internet a more secure place.

Your profile
You have a successfully completed University degree in computer science, IT Security or a comparable qualification
3+ years' experience as a senior developer, with excellent development skills in Python
Hands-on experience operating AWS-based applications and technologies
Experience in web application development and implementation of REST APIs
Experience of Agile Engineering methodologies, such a Kanban or Scrum
Strong analytical, technical and organisational skills
Good knowledge of English required, German language skills are a plus

Our offer
Competitive payment based on the level of seniority and impact
Professional challenges to match your interests and skills
Flat hierarchies and fast decision-making
International like-minded team
Flexible working hours
Subsidised canteen, free gym, free ice cream, language courses and other attractive benefits!

This position is based in Tettnang near Lake Constance in Germany.

Description of the job :
Reporting to the Head of GMA Repair Management, the main roles and responsibilities of the Repair Technical Analyst are:
To contribute actively to the GMA Repair Cost Base optimization.
To bring technical Support to the WW GMA Team.
To analyse and support all matters related to Engineering on Components, Main Elements, Landing Gears and Engines.
To lead and/or support any project related to Engineering and Technical knowledge.
To support RFP campaigns and its associated needs and determine new work-scope whenever necessary with the permanent willing of bringing added value for ATR.

Task & accountabilities :
To provide Technical expertise (i.e. define repair work scope, determine historical “K%” subparts consumption rate) to the Procurement department during commercial negotiations (RFI-RFP).
To visit Supplier’s facilities, assess and challenge their way of working and determine all possible improvement opportunities.
To support the development of any project that would require technical expertise such as but not limited to Cost base reduction initiatives, MRO Partnership project including innovative and dynamic work scope.
To be the “End-to-End” accountable for dedicated projects such as but not limited to Maintenance Digitization, Approved Repair Solutions (DER/DOA or even PMA).
To monitor repair costs and set recommendations in case of deviations, need for adjustments or best practices to be deployed to the World Wide ATR repair network of the approved repair stations.
To identify, analyze and prepare reports on warranty rates, no fault found units, chronic rogue units, premature failures, calculate Component’s reliability and removal exchange rate.
To develop technical improvement plans towards Suppliers in coordination with all services involved (Quality, Procurement, Engineering, Fleet Performance).
To support the WW repair team administrators on all technical issues related to repair orders (i.e. shop finding reports and quotes analyses including CIDs).
To complement all type of presentations in front of Suppliers or for internal use that will be needed for dedicated performance reviews and way forward decision making.

Required skills :
University engineering degree including below detailed skills:
o Mastering of engineering and reliability in the frame of repair activities.
o Deep knowledge of component repair. 5 to 10 year experience in OEM/MRO industry.
o Strong analytical skills and proven knowledge and expertise with any tools related to Data Analytics or Data Scientist.
o Familiarity with component bills of material.
o Fluent in English, other languages would be a plus.
o High level of proficiency in relevant software applications including MS Office applications.
o Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities, excellent time management skills and the proven ability to prioritize work.
o A positive attitude, self-motivated, strong attention to the details.
o Availability and flexibility for international travels.

ATR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Description of the job :
Two vacancies for Technical Product Managers (m/f) have arisen within Airbus Commercial Aircraft in Toulouse. You will join the 'Analytics Accelerator' department within Digital Transformation Office (DTO) organization.

The Digital Transformation Office leads the digital transformation of Airbus group, leading key digital initiatives, defining the group data strategy, and supporting culture change towards more digital and agile ways of working.

The Analytics Accelerator is a central group of data scientists in the DTO. Its mission is to lead the most valuable and challenging data science projects across all parts of the business. It also helps to build up data science expertise the organization and pioneers new ways of working.

As a Technical Product Manager (m/f), your role will be to:

Define the product and service (line) strategy and manage the product and service (line) life cycle from idea to retirement,
Continuously realign the targets using Key Value Metrics on the business value delivered by the product and service (line) to the customers and consumers,
Advocate the product and service (line) to customers and leads communication efforts toward consumers if appropriate,
Work effectively with a self-organized team to identify opportunities and create a product that satisfies the customer including Time, Quality and Cost of the Product.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks will be:

Leading the IT Product MFT team in order to manage the IT Product lifecycle, both developing the products and operating them to meet operational SLA's,
Defining chargeback models for their respective IT Products,
Defining and going-to-market of the product and service (line),
Ensuring that the known Product Vision is translated into a prioritized Product Backlog in alignment with the business product owner,
Establishing two-way-dialogue to translate Business Needs against known technical & resource constraints,
Being responsible for Continuous Release Management,
Ensuring the participation of an End User Advocate with understanding of users and use, and a product that best serves both,
Ensuring the participation of a Customer Advocate responsible for ROI of the features of the product by maximizing the Business Value, including the eventual improvement of the product.

Required skills :
You have the following skills / Knowledge:

IT Background,
IT Product design and development,
IT & Business strategy development,
Agile for project management,
Customers expectations and needs,
Solution deployment,
Change support,
Partners / subcontractors and stakeholders management.

You know how to include and engage the members of your team, and you're not afraid to manage some complex and exciting projects.

Description
Dans le cadre de ses missions, notre client développe des outils mêlant innovation et métier. Vous serez intégré dans l'équipe du développement de l'innovation, appelée « Incubateur » et participerez à des projets innovant à destination de clients finaux. Actuellement nos clients développent des solutions intégrant des technologies de virtualisation d'infrastructure, Big Data, et data science pour la transformation digitale de nos clients industriels. Titre: Stage ingénieur Traitement de signal embarqué ATM H/F
Descriptif_du_poste:
Description de l’entreprise
Capgemini Digital Engineering & Manufacturing Services, filiale de Capgemini, met son expérience et ses compétences en Ingénierie, Informatique technique et Digital Manufacturing au service des secteurs aéronautique, spatial, défense, énergie, transport.
Description de la mission
Votre stage consiste à participer au développement d’un ou de plusieurs outils permettant d’améliorer l’environnement de travail d’une communauté d’experts techniques intervenant dans l’ingénierie aéronautique.
Vous êtes intégré(e) à l’équipe Systèmes de communication qui valide les nouvelles architectures de radiocommunication qui seront déployées après 2020. Ces nouveaux designs s’appuient sur la technologie des radio-logicielles (SDR : Software Defined Radio). Depuis deux ans, nous développons au sein de notre équipe, une application mobile utilisant cette technologie SDR pour sniffer les communications radio aéronautique. Cette application permet d’écouter et de qualifier des échanges audio (par méthode deep learning) et de décoder les messages ACARS envoyés par VHF.
Le stage se déroule en plusieurs jalons/livrables :
Définition du périmètre fonctionnel de l’application :
Conception de l’application :
Activité : Choix des technologies pour le développement
Livrable : Rédaction d’un document de conception décrivant l’architecture du logiciel et les solutions techniques choisies
Accompagner les utilisateurs dans l’utilisation de l’application, prise en compte de leurs retours
Livrables : Manuel d’utilisation/installation, codes sources mis à jour suite aux retours utilisateurs
Vous êtes encadré(e) tout au long du stage d’experts fonctionnels spécialistes des systèmes de communication et du traitement de signal et des data scientist. Vous travaillez en lien étroit avec le département R&D de Capgemini DEMS.
Profil
Issu(e) d'une école d'ingénieur ou d'un cursus universitaire, vous avez suivi une filière informatique orientée développement logiciel. Vous faites preuve de prises d'initiative, d'autonomie, de créativité, d'aptitude à apprendre. Vous vous démarquez au travers de vos capacités d'écoute, de votre sens du service et de votre disponibilité. Enfin, vous possédez les compétences suivantes :
traitement de signal
développement embarqué, DSP
machine learning / deep learning
python / C

L’entreprise pour laquelle nous recrutons est une jeune entreprise innovante, basée à Montpellier et à Paris. Leur ambition est de ne plus jamais laisser les patients seuls face à leur maladie. Pour atteindre cet objectif, ils ont créé un compagnon virtuel qui apporte une aide et un soutien au quotidien aux patients et à leurs proches.
L’équipe est composée de femmes et d’hommes issus de tous les horizons : médecins, ingénieurs, pharmaciens et développeurs. Ils travaillent en association avec les patients et les référents médicaux de chaque maladie pour identifier et répondre au plus près aux besoins des patients.
L’entreprise grandit vite et cherche des talents passionnés pour l’aider à se développer. Si vous partagez ce désir de mettre la technologie au service des patients et que vous souhaitez rejoindre une aventure humaine, innovante et à fort impact social cette offre est faite pour vous.

Définition du cahier des charges avec les équipes médicales
Acquisition des données et création de l’algorithme
Implémentation de l’algorithme dans le code
